title: Rafael van der Vaart tells Tottenham chairman Daniel Levy to sign Hakim Ziyech from Ajax
text:
Share this article via flipboard

Share this article via email

Share this article via messenger

Hakim Ziyech has been backed to join Tottenham (Getty Images)

Rafael van der Vaart has revealed that he has advised Tottenham chairman Daniel Levy to sign Ajax midfielder Hakim Ziyech.

The 26-year-old was heavily linked with a move away from the Dutch champions in the summer following his excellent performances last season.

Ziyech has made another strong start to the campaign with five goals and five assists in 10 Eredivisie appearances so far.

And Van Der Vaart is keen for the Morocco international to make the move to his former club.

Ziyech impressed against Tottenham in the Champions League last season (Getty Images)

‘I really hope he goes to Tottenham,’ Van der Vaart told Voetbal Primeur.

‘I sent a message today to [Daniel] Levy, I said: Get Ziyech after this season.

‘I am convinced that he becomes a sensation in London, and I also wish him that.

‘I hope Spurs takes him and we will see.’
